title.narrative: Core Contribution to the International Service for Human Rights 2021-2022

description.narrative: The project is a core contribution to support ISHR fulfil the goals and implement activities for 2021 and 2022 as outlined in the new multiannual ISHR Strategic Framework 2021-2026. The project is focused on improving the overall situation of human rights defenders internationally and and nationally.

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the UN in Geneva

mailing-address.narrative: Mission permanente du Danemark auprés de l'Office des Nations Unies à Genéve, 56 rue de Moillebeau, Case Postale 435

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: HRDs deprived of liberty, subject to reprisals or other grave violations are able to seek justice and accountability through international and regional human rights bodies and to leverage the voices of civil society, States, and international and regional mechanisms to take action when their rights are restricted (strategic goal 1.3).
- Number of initiatives undertaken for, together with or on behalf of HRDs subjected to reprisals, deprived of their liberty or victims of other grave violations.

HRDs have the tools and capacities (including strategies, networks, knowledge and narratives) to engage and influence international, regional and national mechanisms and actors, online and offline, and, through them, to contribute to the promotion, protection and realisation of human rights at all levels (strategic goal 1.1).
- Number of ISHR trainings and trainees (and breakdown by gender, language, location, priority groups, etc). - Number of tools produced for HRDs such as guides, manuals, publications, online tools.

target.value: - At least 5 ISHR trainings and 100 trainees; - At least 3 tools produced.
- At least 5 ISHR trainings and 100 trainees; - At least 3 tools produced.

title.narrative: States stop or refrain from restricting, hindering or criminalising HRDs and their work, including by repealing or amending restrictive legislation (strategic goal 2.1).
- Number of States in relation to which ISHR operates or advocates which take legislative or policy action to protect HRDs at the national level.

target.value: At least one State (e.g. Nepal, Madagascar, Philippines, Zambia, Togo, Senegal, etc).
At least one State (e.g. Nepal, Madagascar, Philippines, Zambia, Togo, Senegal, etc).

actual.value: Support to HRDs in Sudan, Nicaragua, Phillippines, Colombia, Mexico, Guatemala, Venezuela.
